titles.title: A bill to enhance the enforcement of laws conserving American lobster.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 5/10/1988--Introduced. Prohibits the entry into the customs territory of the United States of any whole lobster or parts of lobster of a specified species that: (1) is smaller than the minimum possession size required under the American Lobster Fishery Management Plan; or (2) is bearing attached eggs or bears evidence of the forcible removal of eggs.
